{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[1194]] &ndash; King [[Richard I of England]] gives [[Portsmouth]] its first [[Royal Charter]].
*[[1230]] &ndash; [[William de Braose (died 1230)|William de Braose]] is hanged by Prince [[Llywelyn the Great]].
*[[1335]] &ndash; [[Otto, Duke of Austria|Otto the Merry]], Duke of Austria, becomes [[Carinthia (duchy)|Duke of Carinthia]].
*[[1536]] &ndash; [[Anne Boleyn]], [[Queen consort|Queen of England]], is arrested and imprisoned on charges of [[adultery]], [[incest]], [[treason]] and [[witchcraft]].
*[[1559]] &ndash; [[John Knox]] returns from exile to Scotland to become the leader of the nascent [[Scottish Reformation]].
*[[1568]] &ndash; [[Mary, Queen of Scots]], escapes from [[Loch Leven Castle]].
*[[1611]] &ndash; The [[King James Bible]] is published for the first time in London, England, by printer Robert Barker.
*[[1670]] &ndash; King [[Charles II of England]] grants a permanent charter to the [[Hudson's Bay Company]] to open up the [[fur trade]] in North America.
*[[1672]] &ndash; [[John Maitland, Duke of Lauderdale|John Maitland]] becomes [[Duke of Lauderdale]] and [[Earl of March]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; Outbreak of the [[Peninsular War]]: The people of [[Madrid]] [[Dos de Mayo Uprising|rise up in rebellion]] against French occupation. [[Francisco de Goya]] later memorializes this event in his painting [[The Second of May 1808]].
*[[1816]] &ndash; Marriage of [[Leopold I of Belgium|Léopold of Saxe-Coburg]] and [[Princess Charlotte Augusta of Wales]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; After anchoring nearby, Captain [[Charles Fremantle]] of {{HMS|Challenger|1826|6}}, declares the [[Swan River Colony]] in Australia.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Stonewall Jackson]] is wounded by friendly fire while returning to camp after reconnoitering during the [[Battle of Chancellorsville]]. He succumbs to [[pneumonia]] eight days later.
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Peru]]vian defenders fight off the Spanish fleet at the [[Battle of Callao]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; The [[April Uprising]] breaks out in [[Bulgaria]].
*[[1879]] &ndash; The [[Spanish Socialist Workers' Party]] is founded in Casa Labra Pub (city of Madrid) by the historical Spanish workers' leader [[Pablo Iglesias]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; ''[[Good Housekeeping]]'' magazine goes on sale for the first time.
*  1885   &ndash; [[Cree]] and [[Assiniboine people|Assiniboine]] warriors win the [[Battle of Cut Knife]], their largest victory over Canadian forces during the [[North-West Rebellion]].
*  1885   &ndash; The [[Congo Free State]] is established by King [[Léopold II of Belgium]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Menelik II]], Emperor of [[Ethiopia]], signs a treaty of amity with Italy, giving Italy control over [[Eritrea]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; Closing ceremony of the [[1906 Intercalated Games|Intercalated Games]] in [[Athens]], Greece.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[General Motors Corporation|General Motors]] acquires the [[Chevrolet Motor Company]] of [[Delaware]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; The first game of the [[Negro National League (1920-1931)|Negro National League baseball]] is played in [[Indianapolis]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; Comedian [[Jack Benny]]'s radio show airs for the first time.
*[[1933]] &ndash; ''[[Gleichschaltung]]'': [[Adolf Hitler]] bans [[trade union]]s.
*[[1941]] &ndash; Following the ''[[1941 Iraqi coup d'état|coup d'état]]'' against [[Iraq]] Crown Prince [['Abd al-Ilah]] earlier that year, the United Kingdom launches the [[Anglo-Iraqi War]] to restore him to power.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Fall of Berlin]]: The [[Soviet Union]] announces the capture of Berlin and Soviet soldiers hoist their red flag over the [[Reichstag (building)|''Reichstag'' building]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: [[Italian Campaign (World War II)|Italian Campaign]] &ndash; General [[Heinrich von Vietinghoff]] signs the official instrument of surrender of all [[Wehrmacht]] forces in Italy.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The US 82nd Airborne Division liberates [[Wöbbelin concentration camp]] finding 1000 dead prisoners, most of whom starved to death.
*[[1946]] &ndash; The "[[Battle of Alcatraz]]" takes place; two guards and three inmates are killed.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The world's first ever [[jet airliner]], the [[De Havilland Comet]] 1 makes its maiden flight, from London to [[Johannesburg]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Tennessee Williams]] wins the [[Pulitzer Prize for Drama]] for ''[[Cat on a Hot Tin Roof]]''.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Berthold Seliger]] launches a rocket with three stages and a maximum flight altitude of more than 100 kilometres near [[Cuxhaven]]. It is the only [[sounding rocket]] developed in Germany.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: An explosion sinks the {{USS|Card|CVE-11|6}} while it is docked at [[Ho Chi Minh City|Saigon]]. [[Viet Cong]] forces are suspected of placing a bomb on the ship. She is raised and returned to service less than seven months later.
*  1964   &ndash; [[First ascent]] of [[Shishapangma]] the fourteenth highest [[mountain]] in the world and the lowest of the [[Eight-thousander]]s.
*[[1969]] &ndash; The British ocean liner ''[[Queen Elizabeth 2]]'' departs on her maiden voyage to New York City.
*[[1972]] &ndash; In the early morning hours a fire breaks out at the [[Sunshine Mine]] located between Kellogg and Wallace, ID, killing 91 workers.
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Falklands War]]: The British [[nuclear submarine]] {{HMS|Conqueror|S48|6}} sinks the [[Argentina|Argentine]] cruiser [[ARA General Belgrano|ARA ''General Belgrano'']].
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Chernobyl disaster|The Chernobyl Disaster]]: The City of [[Chernobyl]] is evacuated six days after the [[Chernobyl disaster|disaster]]
*[[1989]] &ndash; Hungary begins [[Removal of Hungary's border fence|dismantling its border fence]] with Austria, which allows a number of [[East Germany|East Germans]] to defect.
*[[1994]] &ndash; A bus [[Poland bus disaster of 1994|crashes]] in [[Gdańsk|Gdańsk, Poland]] killing 32 people.
*[[1995]] &ndash; During the [[Croatian War of Independence]], [[Serb]] forces [[Zagreb rocket attack|fire cluster bombs]] at [[Zagreb]], killing seven and wounding over 175 civilians.
*[[1998]] &ndash; The [[European Central Bank]] is founded in [[Brussels]] in order to define and execute the [[European Union]]'s monetary policy.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Panamanian election, 1999]]: [[Mireya Moscoso]] becomes the first woman to be elected [[List of heads of state of Panama|President of Panama]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; President [[Bill Clinton]] announces that accurate [[Global Positioning System|GPS]] access would no longer be restricted to the [[United States Armed Forces|United States military]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Yelwa massacre]] ended. It began on 4 February 2004 when armed Muslims attacked the Christians of Yelwa killing more than 78 Christians including at least 48 who were worshipping inside a church compound. More than 630 [[nomad]] Muslims were killed by Christians in [[Nigeria]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Cyclone Nargis]] makes landfall in [[Burma]] killing over 138,000 people and leaving millions of people homeless.
*  2008   &ndash; [[Chaitén (volcano)|Chaitén Volcano]] begins erupting in [[Chile]], forcing the evacuation of more than 4,500 people.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Osama bin Laden]], the suspected mastermind behind the [[September 11 attacks]] and the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]]'s most wanted man is [[Death of Osama bin Laden|killed]] by the [[Navy SEALs|United States special forces]] in [[Abbottabad]], Pakistan.
*  2011   &ndash; An [[2011 E. coli O104:H4 outbreak|E. coli outbreak]] strikes Europe, mostly in Germany, leaving more than 30 people dead and many others sick from the [[bacteria]] outbreak.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[pastel]] version of ''[[The Scream]]'', by Norwegian painter [[Edvard Munch]], sells for $120 million in a New York City auction, setting a new world record for a work of art at auction.
*[[2014]] &ndash; [[2014 Badakhshan mudslides|Two mudslides]] in [[Badakhshan]], [[Afghanistan]], leave up to 2,500 people missing.
